english_translation: A man asked the Prophet ﷺ: 'Which deeds are best?' He replied: 'Faith in Allah and Jihad in His way.' Then the questioner's thigh trembled. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Mah (wait).' Then: 'Then the deed that is better than all other deeds except like a dutiful Hajj.'

english_translation: Abu al-Samh said: I used to serve the Prophet ﷺ. When he wanted to bathe, he said: 'Turn away,' so I did. 'Spread the garment,' meaning I covered him. He brought al-Hasan or al-Husain, they urinated on his chest, so he called for water and sprinkled it on him, saying: 'This is how it is done: it is sprinkled (washed) from the urine of males and washed from females.'

potential_issues.issue: Hisham ibn Ammar's memory errors (Saduq Lahu Awham)
potential_issues.impact: As the first narrator in the chain, Hisham's known errors in memory significantly weaken the entire transmission. Scholars noted his reliability decreased in later life, making any hadith through him questionable

The use of 'an three times in succession (Yazid → Abu al-Khair → Abu Ruhm) introduces significant potential for tadlis (concealment of weak links) or actual disconnections in the chain, making it difficult to verify continuous transmission

potential_issues.issue: Multiple Saduq-level narrators in one chain
